refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the number of bits in each sample in a sound file.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns the number of bits in each sample in a sound file.

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifilcod -- sound file to be queried

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: filebit returns the number of bits in each sample in the sound file ifilcod. In the case of floating point samples the value -1 is returned for floats and -2 for doubles. For non-PCM formats the value is negative, and based on libsndfile's format encoding.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the filebit opcode. It uses the file filebit.csd, and mary.wav.
Example of the filebit opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
The audio file mary.wav is in monoaural CD format, so filebit's output should include a line like this:
instr 1: ibits = 16.000
